q: R-South Carolina) introduced the Tax Relief Certainty Act, a bill that would permanently extend the current individual income tax rates, which will expire on January 1, 2013, and permanently repeal the death tax. Uncertainty is the enemy of prosperity, said Congressman Mike Pence . "By enacting a two-year extension on current tax rates, Congress merely extended the uncertainty that has stifled our economic growth. starting from April 4 will be in charge of Google's day-to-day operations as the CEO. "In this new role I know he will merge Google's technology and business vision brilliantly," Eric Schmidt said. I am enormously proud of my last decade as CEO, and I am certain that the next 10 years under Larry will be even better. Larry, in my clear opinion, is ready to lead, Eric Schmidt wrote. in Turkey, returned to the U.S. to have a lesion surgically removed from his right leg, spurring rumors he will retire. Allen Iverson denies this, as he wrote on his Twitter account: I have never said anything about retirement, nor have I said goodbye to the game of basketball. Once I get past this, my plan is to continue playing at the highest level possible. So don't put me in my rocking chair just yet. Hold on, I'll be back! It's not yet known if the lesion is benign or not, or if it's a cyst. Allen Iverson , 35, is expected to be out for several weeks

said that after losing out to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin over the company's China policy a year ago, " Eric Schmidt lost some energy and focus. " Eric Schmidt was also criticized for allowing Google be overtaken by Facebook, for the company's increasingly frequent privacy scandals and its increasing internal bureaucracy. Together with the co- founders, he decided to step aside.In announcing the move Thursday, Eric Schmidt said that the company no longer needed his "adult supervision and that Page, 38, was ready to run the world's leading internet company. engaged to make-up artist Mezhgan Hussainy last February- admits he struggles to relate to very young kids, but would love to have youngsters of his own to play games with. He said: I worry about it- because of my age. When I was a youngster, my dad used to play soccer and games with me. And I worry that if I was 70. "Also, if children could be born at the age of five I'd quite like that. I like them at that age when they can talk and understand. I'm not sure I could deal with the whole "ga ga goo' thing. But I genuinely like kids. Simon Cowell also admitted Mezhgan, 36, has "softened" him and has finally made him think about settling down forever.
